channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Andy Cohen’s goal for New Year’s Eve? Get Anderson Cooper giggling.
item.description: The “Real Housewives” host also dishes his financial advice and spending habits — like running up big bills on this youthful hobby.

item.title: Instead of sipping Champagne on New Year’s Eve, it may be time to invest in it
item.description: There’s a solid market for collectable bubbly, say experts, even if prices for some bottles have declined in the past year.

item.title: Walgreens and Intel lead list of stocks in the S&P 500 that fell hardest in 2024
item.description: At the end of a second consecutive year during which the S&P 500 has risen more than 20%, two things investors need to remember are that time tends to...

item.title: U.S. Stocks Slip on Last Day of Stellar Year
item.description: Major U.S. stock indexes ended Tuesday’s session in the red, but wrapped up a stellar 2024.

item.title: SEC Writes Off $10 Billion in Fines It Can't Collect
item.description: Internal data shows securities enforcers bring in far less money than their cases indicate.

item.title: Stocks Cap Best Two Years in a Quarter-Century
item.description: Some investors caution against thinking that the rapid pace of gains can continue because interest rates may remain higher than anticipated.

item.title: It has been another disappointing year for bonds. Why now isn’t the time to throw in the towel.
item.description: Longer bond yields are on pace for their biggest four-year climb since 1981 — the tail end of Jimmy Carter’s presidency.

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Fall
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures gave back almost half of the previous day’s 16% gain as prices continue to swing on the prospects of severe winter weather.

item.title: Warren Buffett is topping up his stake in this high-margin internet name
item.description: A regulatory filing shows Buffett has raised his stake in domain-name-registry company VeriSign.

item.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Rises 7.22% This Year to 102.76
item.description: The dollar edged higher on the session to end the year up 7.2%, matching its annual gains in 2022.
